meanings.definition: Capable of being bent or flexed to a certain extent without breaking.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was semiflexible, allowing it to stretch a bit without snapping.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch was semiflexible, swaying gently in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The semiflexible straw decided to do some yoga to improve its bending skills.
meanings.sent4: Her semiflexible willpower allowed her to adapt to new challenges without giving up.
meanings.sent5: The semiflexible wire twisted easily into intricate shapes for the art project.

meanings.definition: Having a moderate degree of flexibility.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast's body was semiflexible, enabling her to perform various stunts.
meanings.sent2: The rubber band was semiflexible, able to stretch just enough to hold things together.
meanings.sent3: The semiflexible ruler enjoyed showing off its ability to bend slightly.
meanings.sent4: His semiflexible schedule allowed for some spontaneity while still being organized.
meanings.sent5: The semiflexible plastic ruler could bend a bit without breaking during measurements.

meanings.definition: Not completely rigid or completely flexible.
meanings.sent1: The semiflexible wire was perfect for creating sculptures that needed some give.
meanings.sent2: The semiflexible plastic tubing could bend slightly to fit around corners.
meanings.sent3: The semiflexible tree branch liked to wave hello to passersby in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her semiflexible approach to problem-solving allowed for creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The semiflexible rubber band could stretch enough to hold things together without being too loose.
